metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3812 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
Multiple memory leaks in the x11_init_protocol function in epan/dissectors/packet-x11.c in the X11 dissector in Wireshark 1.10.x before 1.10.14 and 1.12.x before 1.12.5 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via a crafted packet.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3812` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
libwireshark11 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
libwiretap8 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
libwscodecs2 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
libwsutil9 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
tshark - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
wireshark - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
wireshark-common - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
wireshark-gtk - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
wireshark-qt - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.6.3-1~ubuntu18.04.1').
